ai.summary: Crazy Trail is a 6 km moderate hike in the UK. The route combines grassy paths with gentle ascents and occasional firmer footing, making it suitable for hikers with some experience.
ai.terrain_summary: The terrain is a mix of grassy tracks, compact dirt, some exposed rocky sections, and short stair-like steps. Expect occasional mud after rain and uneven ground.
ai.safety_notes: Check the forecast and daylight hours before you go. Wear sturdy boots with good grip and bring weather-appropriate clothing. Carry a map and compass or GPS, stay on marked paths, and be cautious on wet or rocky sections. Inform someone of your plan, bring water and snacks, and have a charged phone for emergencies.
recommended_gear: Sturdy hiking boots with good grip
Map and compass or GPS device
Fully charged phone and emergency contact info
ai.best_seasons: Spring to Autumn (April–October), with caution and preparedness for variable UK weather
